Commands

Class BinaryCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • Commands.BinaryCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command

    public class BinaryCommand
extends java.lang.Object
implements Command
    A class representing a binary command: these consist of a condition, a command to execute if the condition evaluates to true, and a command to execute if the condition executes to false.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Brecht Gosselé & William Mauclet 2BiR: wtk-cws (Gosselé) en cws-elt(Mauclet)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BinaryCommand(Condition condition, Command todoIfTrue, Command todoIfFalse)
      A new binary command is created, with the given condition and commands.

      Evaluates the condition of this binary command and then executes the correspondent command.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BinaryCommand

        public BinaryCommand(Condition condition,
             Command todoIfTrue,
             Command todoIfFalse)
        A new binary command is created, with the given condition and commands.
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition of this new binary command.
        todoIfTrue - The todoIfTrue command of this new binary command.
        todoIfFalse - The todoIfFalse command of this new binary command.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this command
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Command
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Returns a string representation of this binary command, namely the word "if", followed by the respective string representations of the condition, todoIfTrue and todoIfFalse, and the whole enclosed by brackets.

      • execute

        public void execute(Robot robot)
        Evaluates the condition of this binary command and then executes the correspondent command.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Command
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot that should execute this command.

      • getNbBasicCommands

        public int getNbBasicCommands()
        Returns the number of BasicCommands contained in this binary command.
        Specified by:
        getNbBasicCommands in interface Command
        Returns:
        Returns the sum of the todoIfTrue's number of BasicCommands, and the todoIfFalse's.

      • containsNextStep

        public boolean containsNextStep(Robot robot,
                       int lastStep)
        Returns whether this binary command contains a BasicCommand the given robot has not yet executed, and can execute.
        Specified by:
        containsNextStep in interface Command
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot for which to check if it can execute a basic command in this binary command.
        lastStep - An integer defining unambiguously the last basic command the robot has executed of this binary command.
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean true if this binary command contains a next BasicCommand the given robot can execute in view of the last step the robot has executed of this binary command and of the state of the robot itself. Returns a boolean false if this is not the case.

      • getStepNbOfNextStep

        public int getStepNbOfNextStep(Robot robot,
                      int lastStep)
        Returns the step number of the next BasicCommand the robot can execute in this binary command.
        Specified by:
        getStepNbOfNextStep in interface Command
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot for which to look up the next basic command it can execute in this binary command.
        lastStep - An integer defining unambiguously the last basic command the robot has executed of this binary command.
        Returns:
        An integer indicating the step-number of the next executable BasicCommand in this command for the given robot. This will depend on the last step the robot has executed of this binary command, and on the state of the robot itself.

      • executeStep

        public void executeStep(Robot robot,
               int nextStep)
        Executes the given step of this command.
        Specified by:
        executeStep in interface Command
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot that should execute a step of this binary command.
        nextStep - An integer defining unambiguously which basic command the robot has to execute of this binary command.
